comment: Awful. The worst professor I have ever had. Please save yourself from his wrath. He is genuinely terrible. He is extremely rude, and needs to retire. He said we could use a textbook on the quiz but if you had an electronic copy you couldnt because you shouldve thought about that. Absolutely terrible. Considering getting the dean involved.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I took this class online and had zero instruction from Professor Hewett. He was rude and was horrible at responding to emails. Several times his answer keys for quizzes were wrong and he would refuse to change grades because "other students got it right" even though we could prove it was wrong. I made an A but with a lot of effort. DON'T TAKE HIM
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: He either doesn't respond or takes forever to respond to student's emails. His lectures were just him reading off of power points word for word. You have weekly discussion posts and quizzes and for our final we were basically on our own and given zero resources to study.

The class wasnt hard because all the quizzes were open note/book. The group project is a killer and long, but honestly if you put like 30 pages together he will give you a 100. He doesnt email back for many days. Personally I wouldnt take him again unless I had no choice
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Barley taught a thing! His quizzes are very difficult even if you study the slides and material front and back. He pretty much leaves everyone to fend for themselves, but barely gives any information or guidance on assignments, quizzes, or the group project.

This teacher is horrible. Doesn't teach at all. Doesn't respond to emails, doesnt fix questions that are wrong even when given proof from the text, and talks down to students. Drop class from 2 days a week to one. I cant believe I spent money on this class when I could have just taught myself. Recommended to school for his termination. Not sorry.

Worst professor I have ever had, by far. He gives a group project with requirements that are all over the place and are unclear. There are weekly discussion that are not that difficult but they are not simple discussion posts either, word limit and references are required. Some questions on quizzes were incorrect but he refused to correct them.

This guy doesn't care one bit about his students. After emailing him countless times and either getting no response, or some disrespectful, short-sided response, I just gave up. You have to teach yourself everything, and he is such a boring guy in general. NEVER TAKE HIM!

Talk about a professor who doesn't care, lots of unclear grading criteria, if you email him about being a little more specific he will not help you at all. Group project was super confusing and vague. Discussions were mandatory but were ONLY graded on timelessness and not the content. Confusing deadlines. Finessed a A, but a really crappy prof

Took this class online over the summer. No, it wasn't that the workload was heavy, but you also can't cram anything. Discussions must take up at least 3 days to post and respond with 2 citations each, even for responses. Very unorganized, no rubrics except for discussions, and makes information difficult to find. If you HAVE to take him, good luck.

Worst teacher I have ever had in 22 years of life. Does not care about his students AT ALL. Unclear grading criteria and he does anything he can to take points off. It honestly seems like he wants his students to do poorly. Good luck getting a response if you email him too. At most you will get a very rude 3 words that don't really answeryou. Awful
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This guy is a jerk. I get the feeling he wants his students to fail. His due dates are misleading because everything is due at 12:00 Am on the day it is due. He posts discussions that are a large part of your grade, and if you don't do it the DAY he posts it, he takes of a lot of points for every additional day, even before the due date. Misleading

Total of 20 discussions, 4 tests and a group project. When you first start the class, the discussions may seem a little tedious cause of all the requirements, but once you get the hang of it they start to seem pretty easy. Tests are easy. Group project was not bad if you have a good group!

Overall, he's an ok teacher. He changes dates and is very unresponsive but as long as you go to class, pay attention and establish a good group, you should be fine. He's very old school and is lecture heavy. Best way to get your questions answered is in person, otherwise he won't respond to your emails.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Regularly got dates wrong, but blamed the students. Not much concrete information on the large group project assigned. Strict rules for the discussions, which sometimes consisted of multiple discussions per week. Was not very responsive or constructive despite asking so much of his students.

How are people rating him low? Yes there are discussions every week but just do them and you get at least a 90. Pay attention to discussion due dates. Tests are all on quizlet and google. YES their is a group project but 5 people to do it and it's not hard. have had 3 or 4 tests so far and my lowest grade is a 90. Easy A if you just do work

In my attendance of 3 different universities he was by far the worst professor.  Very rude and nonchalant about your success. Answers your emails unprofessionally with dotted trails...... Never let you try and make a better grade. Discussions end on a Wednesday instead of Sunday.  Grades a discussion like a paper. Big 30 page Group Project and PPT
Big project that is a bulk of your grade. If you take it online, hope you have a decent group. Other than that, not a bad class.

I don't know why this guy is rated a 3.3 bc he is SO EASY. We had a group project throughout the semester -  30 page paper & PowerPoint presentation & he graded it in less than a day & gave us a 100 (there's no way he actually read it). He also gives 100s on all the discussions just as long as you do them on time. 4 tests w answers found on google

Class was taken online and was very accessible. Usually two discussions a week with four exams. Most of the answers can be found online. Get a head start on the group project, or else you'll regret it come mid-semester.   Overall, good professor who gives good feedback, clear instructions, and is easy to contact. Made a boring class enjoyable.

Your grade is made up of discussions posts, a group project, and 4 exams. You usually have to do two chapters each week (Monday-Wednesday). Each chapter has an initial response and 2 other posts to other people's post. No quizzes! Answers to exams are on Google. Don't buy textbook, look online and find an older version.  Don't put off group project
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I took him for an online class and it was super easy. Two discussions a week. 4 Exams. All the answers can be found easily on Google. One group project split up into sections. He makes it clear what he expects from you. I never bought the book I just looked up an old edition pdf on google and it worked perfectly. TAKE HIM.
I took him over summer and loved it. Online tests and quizzes, group project was straight forward and easy.

Professor Hewett has been a huge disappointment this semester. I take online classes because I have to work and I also have to pay bills. Online classes are suppose to give me flexibility. This teacher is unclear about directions, homework, and discussions. The schedule makes no sense and neither does his grading. VERY CONFUSING!

So I usually do not rate on this site but I think that I need to let others know what to expect prior to taking his online class.  It won't save you time and although its online and is suppose to provide flexibility his class does not. Grading policy is if you submit past the first day it is late not the due date. Please tread lightly *beware*
I took Professor Hewett online.  We had a discussion post or 2 each week.  We had 3 group projects, each 10 page paper, and 4 tests, all online.  They were fairly easy, but got harder each time.

Avoid. Inconsistent grading on the group work. In some cases I found myself wondering if he actually read the papers. I am at the end of my undergrad career and have seen it all, this was the most frustrating experience I've had at KSU.

Great professor. Class is very straightforward.. 4 test, weekly graded discussions, and 3 team case analysis. As long as you keep up with the discussions and case analysis' you will do good. I would definitely take this professor again.

I took this class online & during the summer. You will do well if you keep up with the online class dicussions. There is one group project that is pretty easy. There are also 4 online exams; read the chapters. The quizzes are optional but it is helpful. I would take this professor again.

I took this class online with Professor Hewett. Most of your points comes from discussions and you are expected to comment at least three times a week.Also you have to read at least 1-2 chapters a week. The group project was pretty easy. He doesn't expect too much so I would say it's a rather easy class to pass.

Online class. Majority of grade is discussions and the group project (which is very difficult to do online with so many people - 7) Tests count for hardly nothing. Very active on discussion board. Ok professor. Wouldn't take again though.
